ygData.subject: Vehement's Escape or Doom?

Subject: Vehement's Escape or Doom?
To: nbwrpg@egroups.com
MIME-Version: 1.0
Content-Type: text/plain; charset="US-ASCII"

From: KSLawdogg@...

(Some of the powers about to happen, I probably won't be doing in the RPG, 
just doing 'em now for the fun of it)


Vehement/Sun Crusher/Diety/Bloom/Reflector:




    Vehement charged down a hallway, followed by several Brotherhood members 
following him to safety.  He stopped at a large hatch which slid open, the 
dozen Brotherhood members rushing in.
    Vehement activated his wrist comm. unit and yelled into it.  "Seal the 
hatch!  Power up engines and follow flight plan Alpha-Omega AZ Tuscon, it's 
already programmed into the ship.  Vehement smiled as he got an 
acknowledgement.  He let the others leave for their posts as he pressed a few 
buttons on a forearm computer, three digits appearing 3:00, and a second 
later, it was 2:59.  Vehement headed off for the bridge.
    
    Vehement entered the bridge, hearing several acknowledgements from 
personel.  He checked his forearm computer.  Two minutes left.  "Status 
report, Bloom."
    "Engines powering up, shields and weapons at full, we're heading out now, 
Archbishop."
    The Brotherhood Archbishop smiled, sitting down in the middle chair 
between two others in the middle of the bridge.  He felt the slight shaking 
as the engines powered up to full and began speeding them along their way.  
Vehement checked his forearm computer, which read "1:32" and sighed, 
estimating they would be clear in one minute.  
    Over a minute later, everyone on the bridge save the Archbishop let out a 
cry of shock as a robot at the scanners alerted everyone that the Brotherhood 
Alpha Space Station had been destroyed, and the shock wave of the explosion a 
few moments after confirmed, slightly tossing the large battlecruiser.
    "Let us have a moment of silence for our fallen comrades.  They died to 
preserve the ways of the Omniscent One, and they shall not be forgotten." 
    After a complete two minutes had passed of eerie silence,  the Archbishop 
spoke once more.  "Status report, Sun Crusher."
    "Transwarp engines are activating, illustrious one."
    "As they should be.  All is going accordi--"
    "Three Maximal strike cruisers just appeared out of nowhere!  They're 
heading to intercept us!"
    "WHAT?" Vehement yelled, standing up.
    "What are yo--" Sun Crusher was interrupted by a yell, belonging to a 
large bulky Brotherhood member named Bloom, who opened fire with two laser 
pistols, mowing down three members of the Brotherhood.
    "Traitor!  Kill him!" Vehement ordered.  He watched as several of his men 
charged at Bloom, a few being cut down, returning fire knocking Bloom down.  
They didn't see Diety from behind with an energon blade and laser rifle, 
cutting one 'bot down, shooting the rest.
    "I shall deal with this personally." Vehement felt the entire ship shake 
as Maximal laesr cannon fire struck the shields of the ship.
    "SHIELDS AT 91%" the ship's computer said over the bridge's intercom 
system.
    Vehement leapt, tackling Bloom to the ground and punching him quickly.
    
    Diety raised his golden rifle, to be tackled from behind by the green, 
purple, and gray Reflector.

    Sun Crusher stood to his red feet, his red, yellow, and white body 
shining brightly in the ship's light, falling to his knees as missiles soon 
erupted agianst the shields of the Brotherhood craft.
    "SHIELDS AT 76% AND FAILING"
    "Sun Crusher--urgh--return---fire!" Vehement said, getting his hands 
around Bloom's neck, pinning the robot down his superior weight and size.
    Reflector got to his feet, a punch to the gut sending him to his knees, 
Diety roundhousing him, knocking him to the ground.  Diety picked up his 
sword, catching a fireball in the back, sending him crashing to the metal 
ground.
    Sun Crusher got to his post, pressing several buttons, the ship barely 
shaking, but not from enemy weapons fire.  He watched on the main view screen 
as a few blasts of purple energy connected with the shields of a Maximal 
strike crusher.  "Direct hit!  One of the ships is down to 56%." he said as 
the strike cruiser fell back, another one going in front of it.  "Slag."
    Reflector got up, pulling out his laser pistol, firing off two bolts at 
Diety.  But the golden robot rolled out of the way of the laser blasts and 
jumped to his feet, charging up to Reflector and kicking the gun out of his 
hands, followed by a quick jab to the face.
    "I don't think so." Reflector said, two perfect duplicates of himself 
appearing on his sides, both tackling Diety to the ground.  One of them was 
kicked off, but the other one got a good hold on the traitor, and pulled him 
up to his feet, the true Reflector beginning to bombard him with powerful 
punches and jabs.
    Sun Crusher watched as Reflector and his two counerparts managed to stay 
on their feet as missiles collided with the ship.
    "SHIELDS AT 54%"
    Sun Crusher returned fire with a mix of lasers and missiles, letting out 
a cry of joy as an enemy vessel exploded.

    Vehement got to his feet, holding Bloom by the neck.  The gigantic 
Archbishop lifted Bloom three feet of the ground, and threw him to the other 
side of the bridge, laughing as the traitor hit a wall and landed on his 
knees and hands.  Vehement ran, kicking Bloom in the side, not even flinching 
at the sickening crunch as his foot smashed a few internal parts.
    "You dare bretray the Omniscent One, and hope to live?  And what is 
worse, you hope to kill his Archbishop, and his cause?  No, Bloom, no Diety.  
You will die for your treachery." Vehement said as he stood his ground as the 
ship shook.
    "SHIELDS AT 29%"
    The Archbishop raised Bloom to his feet, pointing the palm of his hand at 
Bloom's face.  A bluish-red hue went out from his hand continuosly, hitting 
Bloom's face.  Bloom let out a cry of agony, gripping the sides of his head 
with his hands, trying to go to his knees but couldn't, as if an invisible 
foe was holding him place.
    Vehement's face twisted into a sick grin as Bloom's cries increased, 
until finally he screamed a final glass-shattering cry of despair, and his 
head blew apart.  The leader of the Brotherhood, wiped the mech-fluid off his 
face, walking over to Diety.
    "No!  No!  Vehement, I'm loyal!  The Evil One knows I'm loyal!  NO!" he 
screamed as the same thing was done to him.  Vehement laughed as the body 
dropped to the ground, mech-fluid leaking from the neck.
    "SHIELDS HAVE FAILED, HULL HAS BEEN COMPROMISED.  STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY OF 
THE SHIP IS AT 95%"
    Vehement cursed the computer as he got to his feet, his face covered in 
mech-fluid after hitting the ground.
    "I hit the same ship I hit earlier, Archbishop, it's down to 14% in 
shields."
    "Good!"
    "Sir!" Reflector yelled, now a single entity.  "A transwarp portal is 
opening!"
    "Good!  Let us go into it!  It will be our sanctuary!  Are the Maximals 
following?"
    "Yes!"
    "No matter, let them.  Reroute all excess energy to the shields."
    "Shields up to 25%, Archbishop." Sun Crusher announced.  The ship shook.  
"Or...rather 11%."
    "Return fire!" Vehement ordered as the ship entered the transwarp portal, 
laser cannons firing a dozen blasts off, blowing up the already damaged 
strike cruiser, the remaining one following, returning fire.
    "I got one!" 
    Sparks erupted from the cieling, as well as a few computer terminals.
    "STRUCTURAL INTEGRITY AT 96%, CURRENTLY NO HULL BREACHES"
    "Return fire!" Vehement ordered madly, climbing into his seat, buckling 
himself in with a safety harness, the remaining two Brotherhood members 
following his wise example.
    They felt the ship shake slightly as missiles fired off followed with 
lasers.
    "It's down to 18%"
    "Slag!" Vehement yelled, slamming a fist down, the ship now in the 
transwarp portal, in a kind of transwarp tunnel.  In a mix of bright and dark 
blue, Vehement watched as they continued through.  "Send all energy from the 
gravity generators into the shields."
    "Sir..."
    "Do it!"
    "Very well." Sun Crusher said, knowing it would be deadly to argue.  
"Shields are back--"
    "SHIELDS AT 12%" the computer interrupted.
    "Good." Vehement brought a hand to his chin.  He knew where they were 
going, and there would be plenty of air, but would it be worth it.  He 
gripped the armrests of his chair as the ship began violently shaking.  "WHAT 
IN THE PIT?"
    "We're getting some space-like turbulence!" 
    "Obviously!"


    The Maximal commander of the strike cruiser saw an ensign about to open 
fire once more, but the ensign was interrupted as an officer let out a cry.
    "Energy bolt from the transwarp tunnel is coming at us!"
    The bolt struck the enemy ship, the already weakened shields failing, and 
the bolt tearing a large hole through the strike cruiser, the ship exploding.

    The Archbishop of the Brotherhood let out a small cry of joy as Sun 
Crusher informed him of the remaining strike cruiser's fate.  "We have done 
very well.  Let that be the beginning of our vengeance against the Maximal 
Elders.  Continue--"
    Vehement was thrown against his harness, which if under this kind of 
pressure for a cycle more would've given.  A shower of sparks rained down on 
Vehement, black smoke pouring out from burning computer panels behind the 
three Brotherhood members.  "By the Evil One!  What was that?"
    "A bolt comprised of plasma and...the rest of the energy is unknown.  It 
took out shields and did damage to our hull and engines."
    "Great." Reflector's leader retorted as the ship exited the transwarp 
portal, which closed behind them, a bit of wreckage from the strike cruiser 
following them.  The wreckage struck the engines, causing an explosion.
    "WHAT THE PIT!?  The Omniscent One tests our faith tonight my loyal 
followers!"
    "ENGINES ARE DOWN!"  
    "Can you make a landing to that planet?"
    "Not really.  More like a crash landing." Sun Crusher replied.
    "THEN DO IT!  And scan the planet, I want to know everything!  Or at 
least, everything you can find out!"
